intro: Crepidomanes pseudonymanii, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its drought tolerance and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or as an ornamental plant.
